page.title: 08BISHOP SUTTON PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Due to the need to raise Â£30,000 for essential repairs to Holy Trinity Church, an appeal was conducted and a village meeting held in church on 9th July. The Archdeacon presided,and the Rural Dean, the Vicar the Rev. John Higgins, and 38 parishioners attended. Of 370 letters sent,149 positive and 42 negative replies were returned. To date, gifts received and donations promised for the first year, amount to Â£2,235 with a further Â£887 due from covenants. Altogether 40% of the village have pledged their support for the Parish Church. At a further meeting on 15th July 1985 the P.C.C. although concerned that funds availablle were only 10% of the total needed, decided to go ahead with essential work to gutters,downpipes & soakaways, provided reasonable estimates could be obtained.
